description.para: These functions allow programmers to change the LLEMU

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the emulated three-button LCD has already been initialized.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD has been initialized or false if not.

briefdescription.para: Creates an emulation of the three-button, UART-based VEX LCD on the display.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD was successfully initialized, or false if it has already been initialized.

briefdescription.para: Turns off the Legacy LCD Emulator.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function will clear the entire display, and you will not be able to call any further LLEMU functions until another call to lcd_initialize.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a formatted string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]
Optional list of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Clears the contents of the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Clears the contents of a line of the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the leftmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the leftmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the center button.

detaileddescription.para: When the center button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the rightmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the rightmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Gets the button status from the emulated three-button LCD.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned is a 3-bit integer where 1 0 0 indicates the left button is pressed, 0 1 0 indicates the center button is pressed, and 0 0 1 indicates the right button is pressed. 0 is returned if no buttons are currently being pressed.
Note that this function is provided for legacy API compatibility purposes, with the caveat that the V5 touch screen does not actually support pressing multiple points on the screen at the same time.

simplesect.para: The buttons pressed as a bit mask

briefdescription.para: Changes the color of the LCD background to a provided color expressed in type lv_color_t.
Changes the text color of the LCD to a provided color expressed in type lv_color_t.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to make motors move

briefdescription.para: Sets the voltage for the motor from -127 to 127.

detaileddescription.para: This is designed to map easily to the input from the controller's analog stick for simple opcontrol use. The actual behavior of the motor is analogous to use of motor_move_voltage(), or motorSet() from the PROS 2 API.

This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor voltage from -127 to 127

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_absolute

briefdescription.para: Sets the target absolute position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the position of the motor when initialized or the position when it was most recently reset with motor_set_zero_position().

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The absolute position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_relative

briefdescription.para: Sets the relative target position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the current position of the motor as given in motor_get_position(). Providing 10.0 as the position parameter would result in the motor moving clockwise 10 units, no matter what the current position is.

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The relative position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the velocity for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This velocity corresponds to different actual speeds depending on the gearset used for the motor. This results in a range of +-100 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_36, +-200 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_18, and +-600 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_6. The velocity is held with PID to ensure consistent speed, as opposed to setting the motor's voltage.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the output voltage for the motor from -12000 to 12000 in millivolts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.

parameterdescription.para: The new voltage value from -12000 to 12000

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Changes the output velocity for a profiled movement (motor_move_absolute or motor_move_relative).

detaileddescription.para: This will have no effect if the motor is not following a profiled movement.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the target position set for the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The target position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the velocity commanded to the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The commanded motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to collect telemetry from motors

briefdescription.para: Gets the actual velocity of the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's actual velocity in RPM or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current drawn by the motor in mA.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's current in mA or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the direction of movement for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 for moving in the positive direction, -1 for moving in the negative direction, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the efficiency of the motor in percent.

detaileddescription.para: An efficiency of 100% means that the motor is moving electrically while drawing no electrical power, and an efficiency of 0% means that the motor is drawing power but not moving.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's efficiency in percent or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is drawing over its current limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor's current limit is being exceeded and 0 if the current limit is not exceeded, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor's temperature is above its limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the temperature limit is exceeded and 0 if the the temperature is below the limit, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is stopped.

simplesect.para: Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.
1 if the motor is not moving, 0 if the motor is moving, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is at its zero position.

simplesect.para: Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.
1 if the motor is at zero absolute position, 0 if the motor has moved from its absolute zero, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

briefdescription.para: Gets the faults experienced by the motor.

detaileddescription.para: Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in motor_fault_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: A bitfield containing the motor's faults.

briefdescription.para: Gets the flags set by the motor's operation.

detaileddescription.para: Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in motor_flag_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: A bitfield containing the motor's flags.

briefdescription.para: Gets the raw encoder count of the motor at a given timestamp.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a time in milliseconds for which the encoder count will be returned. If NULL, the timestamp at which the encoder count was read will not be supplied

simplesect.para: The raw encoder count at the given timestamp or PROS_ERR if the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Gets the absolute position of the motor in its encoder units.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's absolute position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the power drawn by the motor in Watts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's power draw in Watts or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the temperature of the motor in degrees Celsius.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's temperature in degrees Celsius or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the torque generated by the motor in Newton Meters (Nm).

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's torque in Nm or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the voltage delivered to the motor in millivolts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's voltage in mV or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.
Additional example code for this module can be found in its Tutorial.
